node.title: Digest of interesting stuff #1
node.description: Hey, wanna share interesting things I had discovered these days.
node.content:
Hey everyone! I know it's been a while since I've posted something, no posts. Now I kind of remembered that I have a blog ) I want to share something with you, and titled this post as Digest of interesting stuff. I'll share some tweets, reddit links, links to blog posts. I'll do my best to write at least 3 blog posts till 1st of March, not gonna spoiler about it. So here we go.

Emacs

Gist.el

As an Emacs user I found this stuff very useful. I use GitHub Gist a lot. Before switching, starting to live in Emacs I had a deal with VSCode, Atom, PHP Storm as well and always first of all looked for that possibility of gist turned on. When you have a problems with code, optimizations, whatever related to programming, you gonna need "temporary paste codes thing", to describe your problem better with code in dev-community/chat and these can be: Pastebin, GitHub Gist, Glot.io, IdeOne, etc. I assume Pastebin is used a lot, and so is GitHub Gist. I consider gists more useful than pastebins, I don't know, I just like it, it's "quick temp code paster" thing I need.

I was a bit upset about that sort of thoughts which were used to tell me, that gists does not exist for Emacs, but fortunately it does exist. Now I'm using it much-much often. Features are incredibly useful. You can list all your gists within Emacs, edit them, either delete also or create new ones.

  • Web Mode
  • Emacs nerd-fonts
  • Clipboard monitor for Emacs - monitors clipboard and pastes contents on change
  • Magit - still it's very useful thing
  • Speed-Type - Practice touch/speed typing in emacs
  • Org-TodoIst
  • Emacs interface to Todoist

Laravel

  • TDD Crash Course by Adam Wathan
  • Laravel Best Practices
  • Source code of Laravel forum - Laravel.io - the stuff you need to look at, code is quite clean to learn/read
  • I would recommend Brent's Laravel series Laravel beyond CRUD

Vuejs

  • Шесть задачек для Front-End разработчика
  • Real-time (one-to-one) chat app with Vuejs and Laravel
  • Upload files to Cloudinary using Vue & Vuetify

Linux

  • Why use different sub-keys for encryption signing
  • 8 super heroic Linux commands that you probably aren't using
  • Compiling Open Source software manually
  • Linux From Scratch - still actual thing
  • Comparing Linux Package Formats - Deb, Flatpak, AppImage, etc.

Other

  • Why Open Source misses the point of Free Software
  • How We Use Github Issues for Project Management & Deployment {VIDEO}
  • TypeSpeed - incredible "toy" to play with to improve your typing speed

Tweets

Wow that's really cool. If anyone wants to play around with a PDP11 you can drop into one with 1 Docker command.

Here's a write up on the process: https://t.co/iMsyAcz2rY

— Nick Janetakis (@nickjanetakis) September 14, 2019

"Put your whole heart into it, love it, invest in it, and care about it. If you do that, things can work out. Even if they don't, you'll grow a lot as a person."@taylorotwell came onto the podcast to share how he built @laravelphp into what it is today.https://t.co/e1MymNXOOZ

«Клёвая форма кредитной карты с гладкими и приятными микровзаимодействиями. Включает форматирование чисел, проверку и автоматическое определение типа карты. Она построена на Vue.js, а также полностью адаптивная».
